Package f18cs350task3

Class Box

  • java.lang.Object
    • f18cs350task3.Box
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class Box
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Defines a two-dimensional box that can be connected to other boxes via Connectors in a doubly linked n-ary tree. Size and position units are arbitrary, but assumed to be the same.

    A reasonable solution is about 98 lines of functional code. The suggested size of each method is in square brackets. A moderately larger solution is acceptable, as is a slightly smaller one; however, anything wildly outside this range is probably suspect.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Box.Corners
      Defines the four corners of a box.

      • clone

        public Box clone()
          throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Returns a deep clone of this box. In other words, cloning this object will clone the connectors to its children, and by extension the children themselves, and then recursively repeat the process with their children. The result should be a completely identical tree structure with completely identical objects that are not the original objects. [9]

        This must be a true deep clone. No instantiation is permitted for Box or Connector.

        This method uses at least the following other methods: connectChild(f18cs350task3.Connector)

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - if clone is not supported; this cannot happen here, but Java still requires it to be declared
